text: Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband, Dhaval Buch, refuted allegations from Hindenburg Research about their involvement in offshore entities linked to an Adani scandal. SEBI addressed the allegations independently, while Buch criticized Hindenburg for not addressing regulatory concerns.

text: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) withdrew over Rs 13,400 crore from Indian equities in August, reversing prior investments. The outflow was driven by the unwinding of the yen carry trade and recession fears in the US. Elevated Indian stock valuations, geopolitical tensions, and weak US job data also contributed to this trend, according to analysts.
title: FPIs turn net sellers, withdraw Rs 13,400 crore

text: Two industry bodies, Amfi and IVCA, voiced support for Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and the markets regulator, dismissing Hindenburg's allegations as unwarranted and lacking context. They emphasized India's robust regulatory framework as a key factor in its economic progress and urged stakeholders to remain confident amid these claims, warning against hindering the nation's development.
title: Two industry bodies call allegations 'unwarranted'

text: In 2022, Madhabi Puri Buch became the first woman and first private sector professional to chair Sebi after a break. Known for her collaborative approach, IT focus, and data-driven decisions, she brought significant changes in market regulation. Before Sebi, she had a significant career at ICICI Bank and experience overseas with Greater Pacific Capital.

text: Dalal Street was not expected to react negatively to a Hindenburg Research report alleging conflicts of interest by Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch. Traders and fund managers expressed more annoyance at the U.S.-based short-seller. The impact of the report seemed minimal compared to global geopolitical and market volatility factors.

text: The markets regulator Sebi dismissed allegations by Hindenburg Research about conflict of interest involving its chairperson, stating that adequate internal mechanisms were in place. Sebi emphasized its actions against Adani Group, highlighted completed investigations, and negated claims of regulatory changes favoring Blackstone. Sebi's response followed a show-cause notice issued to Hindenburg over illegal gains.

text: Government explored a new plan to blend 5% ethanol with diesel (ED-5) as it neared its target of 20% ethanol-blended petrol within two years. text: Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband, Dhaval, refuted allegations by Hindenburg regarding their investments linked to Adani stocks. Adani dismissed Hindenburg's claims as manipulative.

text: Securities and exchange board of India (Sebi) responded to the Hindenburg report, asserting that chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch had made all required disclosures and recused herself in cases of conflict of interest. Sebi clarified the completion of 22 out of 24 investigations into the Adani Group and advised investors to exercise caution before reacting to such reports.

text: The Adani Group denied the latest allegations made by the Hindenburg research. text: India's coal imports rose by 5.7% to 75.26 million tonnes in the first quarter of the current fiscal compared to 71.16 million tonnes in the same period last fiscal, according to Mjunction data. text: The combined market valuation of eight out of ten top firms fell by Rs 1,66,954.07 crore last week, with Reliance Industries and Life Insurance Corporation suffering the most. text: South Africa led West Indies by 154 runs going into the final day of the first Test in Trinidad after rain again curtailed play on Saturday. South Africa began their second innings in aggressive fashion and increased their lead as they were 30-0 at the close with Tony de Zorzi not out on 14 and Aiden Markram on nine.

And Hassan did not disappoint, holding off Ethiopian Tigst Assefa for victory in an Olympic record of 2hr 22min 55sec.

text: Canada's B-Boy Phil Wizard won the inaugural Olympic men's breaking gold in Paris on Saturday, beating France's B-Boy Dany Dann in the final. Breaking, better known as breakdancing, is making its first and possibly last appearance at the Olympics, having been left off the programme for Los Angeles 2028. text: Cybersecurity researchers reported a significant rise in GPS spoofing incidents targeting commercial airliners, particularly near conflict zones. While not directly causing crashes, these incidents could lead to serious complications.

text: They'll be so close Wednesday, at least from our perspective, that just a sliver of moon could fit between them. In reality, our solar system's biggest planet and its dimmer, reddish neighbor will be more than 350 million miles (575 million kilometers) apart in their respective orbits.

text: Over the past century, light pollution has drastically dimmed the visibility of the Milky Way for nearly 3 billion people. text: ChatGPT experienced an outage, with 91% of users facing issues. OpenAI acknowledged the problem, and the service is now back online with performance back to normal. The TOI Tech team verified the restoration on the website and mobile app.

text: Microsoft discontinues Surface Duo smartphones but files a patent for a new foldable device with a single hinge system called 'spine cover plate'. The design aims to eliminate the hinge crease and reduce the device's thickness while offering added benefits and durability. However, its practicality remains uncertain.
title: Microsoft plans to take on iPhone and Android smartphones with this new device

text: Elon Musk's X platform banned over 5 lakh Indian accounts for violating policies, including promoting terrorism and child sexual exploitation. Users should avoid violating policies to prevent account suspension.

text: Google supports the Indian General Election by providing easy access to voting information and countering misinformation. Initiatives include partnering with the Election Commission, prioritizing trusted content on YouTube, and implementing advertising policies for transparency. Measures against AI-generated content are also taken.
title: 3 ways Google aims to support the 2024 Indian General Elections

text: Indian Railways' AI chatbot, AskDisha 2.0, powered by CoRover.AI, offers a range of services like booking tickets, refunds, checking PNR status, cancelling tickets, changing boarding station, checking booking history, and accessing e-tickets via text or voice commands in multiple languages.
title: This new AI tool can help you book train tickets, get refunds and check details on IRCTC website and app

text: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) has reclaimed a spot in the list of the world’s 10 most valuable companies, riding the optimism of the artificial intelligence (AI) boom. TSMC's stock rallied, elevating its market capitalisation to a record, making it higher than Broadcom. Analysts expect TSMC to further advance amid surging AI-related revenue and strong pricing power.
title: Chipmaker TSMC returns to the list of world's 10 most valuable companies: Here’s what led to its comeback

text: Google Maps is updating its Fused Orientation Provider (FOP) API to improve direction accuracy in busy areas. The update combines gyroscope, accelerometer, and magnetometer data, reducing magnetic interference and benefiting Google Maps and third-party apps on Android 5.0 or above.
title: Google Maps to get better with directions with future updates, here’s what’s changing

text: Elon Musk criticizes OpenAI's deviation from mission and advocates AI accessibility for all. Musk announces xAI open sourcing Grok chatbot. OpenAI CEO Altman takes a dig at Musk's chatbot. Musk, obviously didn't like the jab and replied with a long-ish message saying “GPT-4 is about as funny as a screendoor on a submarine.”
title: Elon Musk’s AI company will make Grok chatbot more accessible, here’s how

text: The Moto G54 budget smartphone, with two variants, has received a price cut. The 8GB version is priced at Rs 13,999, and the 12GB variant is selling at Rs 15,999. It features a 6.5-inch FHD+ display, 120Hz refresh rate, and a 50MP main sensor.
title: Moto G54 receives a price cut in India: Here’s how much the smartphone costs

text: Denver city pays $3.76 million in damages due to a wrongful raid caused by Apple's Find My app. An elderly woman's home was mistakenly raided by the police while searching for a stolen truck loaded with guns, ammo, and cash, as reported by CNN. Ruby Johnson filed a lawsuit against Detective Gary Staab and Sgt. Gregory Buschy.
title: How Apple’s Find My app ‘cost’ a US city millions of dollars

text: Bobby Kotick, former head of Activision Blizzard, may buy TikTok amid its potential US ban. A bill to sell TikTok is introduced, backed by President Biden. Kotick discussed acquisition with OpenAI head. Activision Blizzard faced a lawsuit. Concerns about data privacy and ties to China persist. TikTok urges American users to support it.
title: Former Activision boss reportedly wants to buy TikTok
Why Earth Sciences minister Rijiju is upset with this European IT company

text: Xiaomi launched the Xiaomi 14 series in India, offering flagship smartphones with Leica optics and powered by Android 14-based Xiaomi HyperOS. The phones are available for purchase and pre-booking, with exclusive benefits for Xiaomi Priority Club members.
title: Xiaomi 14 series is now available in India: Sale, pre-booking and more

text: The 19th crest gate of the 71-year-old Tungabhadra dam in Karnataka malfunctioned, leading to potential flooding risks downstream in Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh. Engineers estimated that 60TMCFT of water needs to be drained before replacing the gate. Officials placed downstream districts on high alert, and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar assessed the situation at the site.
title: Tungabhadra dam gate gives way, puts lakhs in Karnataka, Andhra at flood risk

text: A 23-year-old employee of Third Wave Coffee was arrested for attempting to record women in the washroom at a Bengaluru outlet. The accused, Manoj, had hidden his phone in a dustbin to capture videos. Upon discovery, the management terminated him and enhanced safety protocols across all cafes. Police investigations continue.
title: Bengaluru cafe employee tries to film women in washroom, held

text: India concluded the Paris Olympics with one silver and five bronze medals, falling short of the expectations set by the 2020 Tokyo Games. Despite the disappointment in badminton, boxing, and archery, six fourth-place finishes showed potential. India's medal tally placed it 71st among 84 nations, despite improved training facilities and significant government spending.
title: 6 medals, 0 gold: India's haul sub-par but it's not all gloom

text: The adoption of eSIMs in India has been rather slow. Although major telecom operators and top-tier smartphone brands have supported eSIMs since years now.
title: How this 'China ban' may be behind e-SIMs not becoming 'popular' in India

text: Hezbollah militants fired approximately 30 rockets from Lebanon into northern Israel overnight, landing in open areas without causing casualties, according to the IDF. Israel responded by striking the launch sites in Lebanon. US defense secretary Lloyd Austin announced deployment of naval assets to the region, underscoring the US commitment to Israel's security amid rising tensions.
title: Watch: Hezbollah fires 30 rocket barrage on northern Israel

text: Vinod Khosla, founder of Khosla Ventures, discussed the potential of AI in national security, education, and healthcare. He emphasized the need for AI-driven digital public infrastructure in India, advocating for AI tutors and doctors. Khosla also supported universal basic income and highlighted the importance of risk-taking in startups.
title: Free primary care physician for every Indian is doable in 2-to-5 years: Vinod Khosla

text: CrowdStrike faced significant fallout after a software update caused a global IT outage affecting airlines, banks, and essential services. Despite a valuation drop from $83 billion to under $60 billion, the company's president, Michael Sentonas, accepted the 'Most Epic Fail' award at the Pwnie Awards, emphasizing accountability and commitment to improvement.
title: The award for ‘most epic fail’ goes to this $50 billion-plus company

text: Supriya Sule's WhatsApp account was hacked during a party event, and a $400 ransom was demanded. Pune rural police quickly restored her account. Sule urged users to be vigilant with their phone security and avoid responding to unknown numbers. Investigations are ongoing.
title: Sule’s WhatsApp account hacked, $400 demanded

text: Waterlogging complaints at various places; 3 Delhi-bound flights diverted, 50 delayed
title: Delhi weather: Rain woes continue in city, more showers expected

text: A man recently exposed a new UPI scam through a video on social media. Fraudsters pose as bank representatives, urging victims to make UPI payments to verify accounts. Users shared similar experiences, highlighting the need for vigilance. Key precautions include not sharing UPI PINs, enabling two-factor authentication, and using official UPI apps. Reporting suspicious activity promptly is essential.
title: Man shares screenshot, video of 'new UPI scam' people are losing money to

text: Fooled them into converting their $1.4m savings into gold before taking it away
title: Gujarati, Chinese duo dupe US couple out of $1.4m in gold

text: A seven-year-old boy named Tarun drowned in a rainwater pond in a DDA park in Rohini Sector 20. The family was unaware of his whereabouts until informed by authorities. The park lacked safety measures and adequate warnings about the pond, leading to this tragic incident. The incident raised concerns about negligence as there was no security guard present.
title: 7-year-old drowns in Delhi park, 3rd such death

text: Resident doctors at major government hospitals in Delhi decided to indefinitely halt elective services from Monday in protest of the rape and murder of a doctor in Kolkata. They demanded immediate action and increased safety measures for healthcare workers, including enhanced security in hospitals and the implementation of the 'Central Protection Act for Doctors.'
title: Kolkata doctor rape-murder case: Delhi resident doctors to halt elective services indefinitely

text: India’s 2012 London Olympics bronze medalist Saina Nehwal believes PV Sindhu’s future performance will largely depend on her fitness. Sindhu and Nehwal are the only Indian badminton players to have won Olympic medals (one silver and two bronze). Nehwal also supported providing medal-winning athletes with government/corporate jobs for financial stability and security.
title: Saina Nehwal on PV Sindhu's 2028 Olympics chances

text: The Paris Olympics concluded with a spectacular ceremony at Stade de France, featuring Hollywood flair with Tom Cruise's appearance. The event seamlessly transitioned through various moods, with IOC president Thomas Bach praising the games and emphasizing their potential for peace. The Olympic flag was handed over to Los Angeles for the next Games.
title: Paris Olympics conclude with a spectacular closing ceremony

text: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin criticized the Right to Match rule ahead of the IPL 2025 auction, arguing it fails to provide players with their true market value. The BCCI discussed potential changes, including the reintroduction of RTM and extending the mega auction cycle to five years. Ashwin emphasized the rule's unfairness to players and other franchises.
title: Ashwin opposes reintroduction of this 'unfair' IPL auction rule

text: A purported letter from former Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina suggests her removal after 15 years was due to US pressure over St Martin’s Island. The letter indicates her refusal to give up control of the island led to her ouster. Hasina, now in India, promises to return soon, denying allegations of student insults.
title: US pressure over St Martin’s Island led to exit, claims ‘Hasina’s letter’

text: Dalal Street was not expected to react negatively to a Hindenburg Research report alleging conflicts of interest by Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch. Traders and fund managers expressed more annoyance at the U.S.-based short-seller. The impact of the report seemed minimal compared to global geopolitical and market volatility factors.
title: Hindenburg report not big negative for D-Street: Market players

text: Sheikh Hasina's son, Sajeeb Wazed, asserted that his mother did not resign as Bangladesh's PM, contradicting earlier claims by Mohammad Touhid Hossain, an interim government's adviser. Wazed confirmed that Hasina did not make any such statement before leaving for India. Hossain emphasized maintaining balanced foreign relations, particularly with India and China, during the interim government's tenure.
title: Sheikh Hasina never resigned as Bangladesh PM, claims son Wazed

text: Hindenburg Research responded to Madhabi Puri Buch and Dhaval Buch's release, which called their previous report character assassination. Hindenburg highlighted critical questions and admissions, including an email Buch sent in 2018 on behalf of her husband. They questioned Buch's investments through her husband while serving as a SEBI member and noted Buch's connection to a fund linked to Vinod Adani.
title: Madhabi’s response raises new critical questions: Hindenburg Research

text: Forensic tests confirmed that traces of blood and skin found under the nails of the murdered 31-year-old doctor matched those of Sanjay Roy, the arrested suspect. This evidence was deemed crucial. Roy's policewoman sister disowned him, demanding the harshest punishment. CM Mamata Banerjee urged a fast-track trial, insisting the perpetrator must be hanged.
title: Forensic tests point to suspect’s hand in Kolkata doctor’s rape-murder

text: Heavy rainfall in northern India resulted in the deaths of 31 people across Rajasthan, Himachal Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Punjab. Significant incidents included a family in Punjab washed away in their car and multiple drownings in Rajasthan. Officials were working to provide assistance amid widespread damage and disruptions. Rescue operations were ongoing to find missing persons.
title: Rain fury claims 30 lives in 4 northern states; 5 missing

text: The shootout in Anantnag's upper reaches led to three deaths, including two soldiers and one civilian. The operation continued amidst challenging conditions to trace the terrorists believed to be from Jaish-e-Mohammed. Officials are investigating civilians' presence near the shootout, and preventive measures are in place to ensure safety during local pilgrimages.
title: Civilian dies, toll in Jammu & Kashmir encounter hits 3

text: A Dehradun special Pocso court acquitted a 42-year-old man, accused of raping his 15-year-old daughter, after five years in jail. Evidence revealed the girl falsely incriminated him due to his objections to her relationship and school attendance. The court found her allegations instigated by her boyfriend and declared the man innocent last week.
title: Dad freed after 5 years for daughter’s ‘rape’

text: Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee contacted Odisha's Mohan Charan Majhi regarding the assault of Bengali-speaking workers in Odisha, labelled as 'Bangladeshis'. Videos showed attacks in Jajpur, Kendrapada, Jagatsinghpur, and Sambalpur. The Odisha government has instructed police to remain vigilant, and a helpline has been launched for affected workers to seek assistance.
title: Bengalis labelled Bangladeshis, attacked in Odisha: Didi to Majhi

text: Samajwadi Party’s Dalit leaders criticized the proposal of sub-categorizing Scheduled Castes, calling it a divisive strategy. Veteran MPs RK Chaudhary and Awadhesh Prasad asserted that the SP, led by Akhilesh Yadav, supports SC/ST unity as envisioned by Ambedkar. This stance aligns with the party's effort to appeal to the weakening BSP vote base.
title: Sub-quota a plot to divide & rule Dalits, allege SP veterans

text: The Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president PT Usha has said that IOA-appointed Chief Medical Officer Dr Dinshaw Pardiwala should not be held responsible for the disqualification of Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat from the women's 50kg final event at the Paris Olympics, and it's the coach and support staff of grappler that should take responsibility.
title: PT Usha defends IOA medical team over Vinesh's disqualification

text: In Addu city, Maldives, India's Foreign Minister S Jaishankar and his Maldivian counterpart Moosa Zameer inaugurated key infrastructure projects. Jaishankar emphasized the importance of the Maldives in India's 'Neighbourhood First' policy. India has invested significantly, with projects aimed at regional development, economic growth, and improved connectivity, reaffirming their strong bilateral relationship.
title: Maldives at heart of 'neighbourhood first' policy: EAM S Jaishankar

text: Charubala, the wife of former Manipur MLA Yamthong Haokip, was killed in an explosion in Kangpokpi district. The blast, initially suspected to be a militant attack, might have occurred while she was burning waste in an abandoned compound. Haokip and their daughter were unharmed. Haokip had switched from Congress to BJP before the 2022 assembly polls.
title: IED explosion near home kills ex-MLA’s wife in Manipur

text: Odisha's transport minister recently called for an investigation into helicopter rides taken by V K Pandian, a bureaucrat-turned-politician, between February and September last year. Questions have arisen about the costs and authorization of these rides, as 450 helipads were constructed using government funds. Officials promise a thorough probe into the expenditures and permissions involved.
title: 450 helipads for Naveen aide under scanner

text: Sharad Pawar's convoy was stopped by Maratha activists in Kurduvadi, demanding his support for Maratha reservation. During his rally in Barshi, an activist attempted self-immolation but was stopped by police. Pawar criticized PM Modi for failing to double farmers' incomes and neglecting youth unemployment issues, claiming the economy could suffer as a result.
title: Maratha quota protesters halt Sharad Pawar’s convoy, activist tries self-immolation

text: A recent IITM study indicated a significant rise in extreme rainfall events in India by the end of the century due to high carbon dioxide emissions. The Western Ghats and central India are projected to be most affected. Areas with extremely heavy rainfall may increase by 18%, with intensity rising by 58%, impacting socio-economic conditions.
title: 'Extreme rainfall' risks to rise for India: Study

text: Four armed men were feared killed in a fratricidal shootout between militants and village guards in Manipur's Tengnoupal district, police reported. A militant from the United Kuki Liberation Front and three village volunteers from the same community reportedly died near Molnom area. Ongoing search operations by central forces have not yet recovered the bodies.
title: Militants, village guards exchange fire, 4 feared killed

text: The markets regulator Sebi dismissed allegations by Hindenburg Research about conflict of interest involving its chairperson, stating that adequate internal mechanisms were in place. Sebi emphasized its actions against Adani Group, highlighted completed investigations, and negated claims of regulatory changes favoring Blackstone. Sebi's response followed a show-cause notice issued to Hindenburg over illegal gains.
title: Sebi: Have mechanisms to fix conflict of interest issues

text: Eleven individuals from Bangladesh were arrested for illegal entry into India, intercepted at the West Bengal, Tripura, and Meghalaya borders by the Border Security Force. They will be handed over to state police for further legal action. BSF has recently prevented several infiltration attempts, sending back numerous Bangladeshis with the help of Border Guard Bangladesh.
title: 11 Bangladeshis held in West Bengal, North-East for illegal entry

text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi released 109 climate-resilient, high-yielding, and biofortified varieties of 61 crops. He urged Krishi Vigyan Kendras to inform farmers about these varieties, which are tailored for different agro-climatic zones. Modi emphasized their potential to boost yields and incomes, and encouraged sustainable farming. Agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan was present.
title: PM Modi releases 109 high-yielding, climate-resilient crop varieties

text: A group of senior BJP members miffed with Karnataka BJP president BY Vijayendra planned a 188km 'Ballari Chalo' padayatra to highlight issues such as the Valmiki corporation scam and diversion of SCPTSP funds. Led by MLAs Basanagouda Patil Yatnal and Ramesh Jarkiholi, they aimed to brand the state government as anti-Dalit pending high command approval.
title: Miffed with state chief, Karnataka BJP bloc plans own padayatra

text: In 2022, Madhabi Puri Buch became the first woman and first private sector professional to chair Sebi after a break. Known for her collaborative approach, IT focus, and data-driven decisions, she brought significant changes in market regulation. Before Sebi, she had a significant career at ICICI Bank and experience overseas with Greater Pacific Capital.
title: Tough-talking Madhabi Puri Buch broke several barriers

text: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) withdrew over Rs 13,400 crore from Indian equities in August, reversing prior investments. The outflow was driven by the unwinding of the yen carry trade and recession fears in the US. Elevated Indian stock valuations, geopolitical tensions, and weak US job data also contributed to this trend, according to analysts.
title: FPIs turn net sellers, withdraw Rs 13,400 crore

text: Two industry bodies, Amfi and IVCA, voiced support for Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and the markets regulator, dismissing Hindenburg's allegations as unwarranted and lacking context. They emphasized India's robust regulatory framework as a key factor in its economic progress and urged stakeholders to remain confident amid these claims, warning against hindering the nation's development.
title: Two industry bodies call allegations 'unwarranted'

text: Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus was acquitted in a second legal case on Sunday after Bangladesh's anti-corruption commission sought to withdraw prosecution. Yunus, along with 13 others, faced charges for misappropriating about Bangladeshi taka 25.22 crore from Grameen Telecom workers’ profit funds. Earlier, Yunus and Grameen Telecom officials were also cleared of labour law violations by a Dhaka tribunal.
title: Muhammad Yunus acquitted in corruption case

text: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy acknowledged Ukraine's incursion into Russia's Kursk region to apply pressure on Moscow's forces. The offensive led to evacuations and heightened security measures in Russia, with intense battles ongoing. Zelenskiy emphasized the move as a step to 'restore justice.' Despite reinforcement, the situation remains critical with injuries and significant damage reported.
title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine's shock Kursk attack to pressure Russia and 'restore justice'

text: A 7.1 earthquake in southern Japan led to a warning from the Meteorological Agency about possible major quakes. Prime Minister Kishida canceled his Central Asian trip for earthquake preparedness. Experts predict a 70-80% chance of a major quake in the Nankai Trough. Earthquakes with a magnitude greater than 8 are classified as megaquakes.
title: Japan issues its first-ever 'megaquake warning'; know all about 'big one'
